arm_group.description: examine patient's fundus by 90D fundus pre-set lens

brief_summary.textblock:
To evaluate the impact of telemedicine system in rural hospitals for diagnosis and treatment
      of Diabetes retinopathy and Diabetes macular edema.

clinical_study.brief_title: Uptake of Telemedicine System Trial in Rual Canton

detailed_description.textblock:
Telemedicine system mainly contains a comprehensive eye examination electric-records
      (E-record), which can transfer the fundus pictures from rural hospitals to professional
      Graders (golden standard for a diagnose of Diabetes Retinopathy (DR) and Diabetes Macular
      Edema(DME)). In Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center (ZOC). By this system, the investigators can
      evaluate the capacity of rural eye doctors about the diagnosis of DR/DME, and give proper
      suggestions for the treatment and revisit plan.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age > 40y, diagnosed (Diabetes Retinopathy) DR,10% normal patients

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  unconsciousness, history of diabetic ketoacidosis, cardiac insufficiency, Severe
             atrioventricular block, hepatic insufficiency , allergic to mydriatic

intervention.description: rural doctors exam eye fundus by 90 D
taking fundus pictures and graded by graders in ZOC

facility.name: Zhongshan Ophthalmic Center, No.54, Xianlienan Road

clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Telemedicine System to the Diagnosis and Treatment of Diabetes Retinopathy in Rural Canton

primary_outcome.description: To compare the sensitivity, specificity and positive and negative predictive value for a diagnosis of DR/DME , a diagnosis of DR/DME  requiring treatment, of trained rural doctors and an automated grading system, as compared to trained graders using photographs (the gold standard)
primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of trained doctors in diagnosing DR/DME versus photo grading and automated grading
primary_outcome.time_frame: 2 years after the telemedicine begin to use

primary_outcome.description: Cost-effectiveness of three methods of DR screening (trained rural doctors versus telemedicine versus automated grading)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: vice director,Blindness Prevention and Treatment Department

secondary_outcome.description: Frequency with which trained rural doctors continue to implement suggested examinations (IOP, gonioscopy, pupil exam, dilated examination)
secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of comprehensive eye examination taken by rural doctors

secondary_outcome.description: Frequency with which patients get comprehensive eye examinations in rural hospitals, and its influencing factors.
secondary_outcome.measure: comprehensive eye examination rate among patients in rural hospitals

secondary_outcome.description: to evaluate the usage rate of E-record by rural doctors when they see patients in the eye clinic, and its influencing factors.
compare the cost-effectiveness of van for laser treatment to DR/DME patients with the transfer treatment in ZOC

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
